get.description: This endpoint allows site administrators to retrieve a list of audit logs. Administrators can filter logs based on various parameters such as event category, event type, user email, tenant ID, app source, and date range. This helps in tracking user and administrative activities for security, compliance, and troubleshooting purposes.

parameters.name: eventCategory
parameters.description: Specify the category of the event. Allowed values are User, Permission, Settings.

parameters.name: eventType

PermissionEntity.description:
Specify an entity of item for permission.

Allowed permission entities are:

`"AllCategories"` `"AllDashboards"` `"AllDataSources"` `"AllSchedules"` `"AllSlideshow"` `"DashboardsInCategory"`

`"SpecificCategory"` `"SpecificDashboard"` `"SpecificDataSource"` `"SpecificSchedule"` `"SpecificSlideshow"`

`"AllGroups"` `"AllPermissions"` `"AllSettings"` `"SpecificGroup"` `"SpecificPermissions"` `"SpecificSettings"`

`"UsersandGroups"`

PermissionAccess.description:
Specify an access type for item.

Allowed permission access values for the permission entities:

1. `"AllCategories"` `"AllDataSources"` `"AllSchedules"` `"AllSlideshow"` accepts `"Create"` `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"`

`"ReadWriteDelete"`

2. `"AllDashboards"` `"DashboardsInCategory"` accepts `"Create"` `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"` `"ReadWriteDelete"` `"Download"`

3. `"SpecificCategory"` `"SpecificDataSource"` `"SpecificSchedule"` `"SpecificSlideshow"` accepts `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"`

`"ReadWriteDelete"`

4. `"SpecificDashboard"` accepts `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"` `"ReadWriteDelete"` `"Download"`

5. `"AllGroups"` accepts `"Create"`

6. `"AllPermissions"` `"AllSettings"` `"SpecificGroup"` `"SpecificPermissions"` `"SpecificSettings"` `"UsersandGroups"`

accepts `"Manage"`

UserId.description: Specify the User ID to whom the permission needs to be added.

ItemId.description:
Specify the item ID of particular item like Category, Dashboard, Datasource,Schedule, Slideshow.

Item Id is required for the following permission entities:

`"SpecificCategory"` `"SpecificDashboard"` `"SpecificDataSource"` `"SpecificSchedule"` `"SpecificSlideshow"`

`"DashboardsInCategory"`

ScopeId.description:
This defines the name or ID of a specific item for managing permissions. It allows administrators and authorized users to delegate permission management, as well as the management of settings and users/groups. This enables users to share access to resources, such as dashboards, with other users, and to manage groups and settings.

Allowed Scope Id for permission entities:

1. `"SpecificPermissions"` accepts `"Category"` `"Dashboard"` `"Datasource"` `"Schedule"` `"Slideshow"`

2. `"SpecificGroup"` accepts Group Id

3. `"SpecificSettings"` accepts `"AuthenticationSettings"` `"CORSPolicySettings"` `"DashboardSettings"` `"EmbedSettings"`

`"Integrations"` `"LookAndFeel"` `"NotificationSettings"` `"Security"` `"SiteSettings"` `"UserDirectorySettings"`

`"SiteCredentials"` `"Accounts"` `"Connectors"` `"DataStoreSettings"` `"Email"` `"Widgets"`

Permission.description: Specify the details of the group permissions.

StartTime.description:
Start time of the schedule.
The format should be ISO 8601
i.e. yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ. E.g. 2022-02-15T06:55:00Z.

NeverEnd.description:
When set to true, it creates a schedule that never ends.
**Note**: The NeverEnd is true by default. To set the end time for the schedule, fill the properties of either EndAfterOccurrence or EndDate; otherwise, it remains empty.

EndAfterOccurrence.description:
The number of occurrences after which the schedule will be completed.
? For Example: If you provide empty 5, the schedule will end after the completion of 5 occurrences.

EndTime.description:
End time after which the schedule should stop. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.
? For Example: If you provide empty an end date-time, the schedule will end when the end date-time is reached.
? E.g. 2022-02-15T06:55:00Z.

ScheduleType.description:
Schedule frequency.
? Values allowed Weekly only.

RecurrenceWeeks.description: Enter the Recurrence week By default 1.

RecurrenceDays.description:
Enter the day from the list.
(Values allowed are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday).
For Example: Monday.

RefreshSettings.description:
Refer to the JSON syntax below to configure Refresh settings.

 **Note**: Refresh settings is only applicable for the web extract type data source. It will not work for live connection mode data sources.

ApiScheduleRequest.description: Details about the schedule that was passed will be added.

DashboardViewId.description: Specifies the View ID to schedule that specific dashboard view.

DashboardWidgetId.description: Specifies the Widget ID to schedule that specific dashboard widget.

ExportType.description: Specifies the export type to schedule the dashboard. Valid values: `Excel` `Image` `Pdf`.

StartTime.description: Specifies the UTC start date-time of schedule. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`.

NeverEnd.description:
When set to true, it creates a schedule with no end.

 **Note**: By default, the NeverEnd is set to true. To set the end time for the schedule, fill the properties of either EndAfterOccurrence or EndDate; otherwise remains empty.

EndAfterOccurrence.description:
Specifies the number of occurrences after which the schedule will be completed. 

 For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will end after the completion of 5 occurrences.

EndDate.description:
Specifies the UTC end date-time of schedule, after which schedule will be completed.

The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`. For example: If you provide an end date-time, the schedule will end when the end date-time is reached.

UserList.description: Provides a list of email addresses or user IDs to the recipients who will get the schedules.

GroupList.description: Provides a list of group IDs to the recipients in the group list who will get the schedules.

ExternalRecipientsList.description: Provides a list of email addresses to the email recipients who will get the schedules.

ScheduleType.description:
Specifies the schedule type to schedule the dashboard. Valid values: `Hourly` `Daily` `Weekly` `Monthly` `Yearly`. 

 **Note**: If you choose the schedule type as `Monthly`, provide a value to the `MonthlySchedule` property, and leave the (HourlySchedule, DailySchedule, WeeklySchedule and YearlySchedule) properties empty.

IsEnabled.description: Returns true, if the schedule is enabled.

FailureNotificationToOwner.description: Returns true, if the failure notification to an owner is enabled.

FailureNotificationToRecipient.description: Returns true, if the failure notification to the recipient is enabled.

HourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

DailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

WeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

MonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

YearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

EnableDataAlert.description: Returns true, if schedule data alert is enabled.

DashboardId.description: ID of the dashboard (Required if data alert is enabled).

DataSourceName.description: Name of the data source (Required if data alert is enabled).

WidgetName.description: Name of the widget (Required if data alert is enabled).

ConditionCategory.description:
Specifies the type of data alert trigger to export the dashboard.
Values allowed are Value Changes, Increases, Continuously Increases, Decreases, Continuously Decreases (Required if data alert is enabled)

ConditionalResult.description: Specifies the result of the filter condition (Required if data alert is enabled).

ConditionalInformations.description: Specifies the details of the filter condition.

ConditionJoinType.description:
Specifies the type of join for the column filter. Determines how multiple filter conditions should be combined.
Values allowed are AND, OR, AND NOT, OR NOT

RelationalOperators.description:
Specifies the type of relational operator to use for filtering values in a column.
Values allowed are GREATERTHAN, GREATERTHANOREQUALS, LESSTHAN, LESSTHANOREQUALS, EQUALS, NOTEQUALS

IsCustomValue.description: Returns true, if custom filter is enabled.

CustomValue.description:
Specifies the custom value.

**Note:** If IsCustomValue is set to true, a custom value must be provided.

FilterName.description:
Specifies the filter name.

**Note:** The syntax for the filter name is in the format Filter(count); for example, Filter1. You can increase the prefix count to add more filters.

LeftOperand.description: Specifies the details of the column to be used for the left-hand side of a filter condition.

RightOperand.description:
Specifies the details of the column to be used for the right-hand side of a filter condition.

**Note:** If IsCustomValue is set to false, then RightOperand is required.

Filters.description: Specifies a filter to be applied to a specific column.

JoinType.description:
Specifies the type of join for the column filter. Determines how multiple filter conditions should be combined.
Values allowed are AND, OR

Field.description: Specifies the structure and details of the columns used for filtering data.

Condition.description: Specifies the details of the where condition used to filter data.

ConditionType.description:
Specifies the type of condition being specified.
Values allowed are ACTUAL, CUSTOM

Conditions.description:
Specifies the condition to be applied on the column.
Values allowed are CONTAINS, START WITH, ENDS WITH, NOT CONTAINS, INCLUDES, EXCLUDES

Size.description:
PDF page size.
Values allowed are A3, A4, A5, Letter

Orientation.description:
PDF page orientation.
Values allowed are Landscape, Portrait

Extension.description:
Excel or Image extension.
Values allowed for Excel file are xlsx, xls

Values allowed for Image file are jpg, png
Extension.default: xlsx for Excel and jpg for image

FtpURL.description: Use the FTP URL to save the exported file.
Use the FTP URL to save the exported file.

ApiHourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

ScheduleInterval.description:
Specifies the hour interval. Based on this interval, the schedule will run continuously until the end time.

The format should be `HH:mm`.

ApiDailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

RecurrenceType.description:
Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs every day or every working day.

Valid values: `EveryNdays` `EveryWeekday`. **Note**: If you choose the recurrence type as EveryNdays, provide a value to the `EveryNdays` property, and leave the (EveryWeekday) property empty.

EveryNdays.description:
Specifies the day interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 2, the schedule recurs every 2 days.

EveryWeekday.description: For the schedule to recur every working day, set to true.

ApiWeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

RecurrenceWeeks.description:
Specifies the week interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 2, the schedule will recur every 2 weeks.

RecurrenceDays.description:
Specifies the list of days the schedule recurs.

Valid values `Sunday` `Monday` `Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. For example: If you provide `Sunday`, the schedule will recur sunday's of every 2 weeks.

ApiMonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

RecurrenceType.description:
Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs on a day basis or on the customized day basis.

Valid values: `DayRecurrence` `CustomRecurrence` **Note**: If you choose the recurrence type as DayRecurrence, provide a value to the `DayRecurrence` property and leave the (CustomRecurrence) property empty.

DayRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the day specified on the month interval.

CustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the customized day of the specified month interval.

ApiMonthlyScheduleDayRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the day specified on the month interval.

DayInterval.description:
Specifies the number of day interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 10, the schedule will recur every 10th day.

MonthInterval.description:
Specifies the number of month interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 3, the schedule will recur 10th day of every 3 months.

ApiMonthlyScheduleCustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the customized day of the specified month interval.

WeekOfMonth.description:
Specifies the week of the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `first` `second` `third` `fourth` `last`. For example: If you provide second, the schedule will recur on the second week.

DayOfWeek.description:
Specifies the day of the week the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `day` `weekday` `weekendday` `Sunday` `Monday`

`Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. For example: If you provide Sunday, the schedule will recur on the second week of sunday.

MonthInterval.description:
Specifies the number of month interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will recur second week of sunday's of every 5 months.

ApiYearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

YearInterval.description:
Specifies the number of years the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will recur every 5 years.

RecurrenceType.description:
Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs on a month basis or on the customized month basis.

Valid values: `MonthRecurrence` `CustomRecurrence`. **Note**: If you choose the recurrence type as `MonthRecurrence`, provide a value to the MonthRecurrence property, and leave the (CustomRecurrence) property empty.

MonthRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the month and number of years specified in `YearInterval` property.

CustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs in the customized month based on the number of years provided in the `YearInterval` property.

ApiYearlyScheduleMonthRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the month and number of years specified in `YearInterval` property.

MonthOfYear.description:
Specifies the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `January` `February` `March` `April` `May` `June`

`July` `August` `September` `October` `November` `December`. For example: If you provide April, the schedule will recur in April of every year. Here, the (year) is the value provided in the `YearInterval` property.

DayOfMonth.description:
Specifies the day of the month the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 20, the schedule will recur 20th April of every year.  Here, the (year) is the value provided in the `YearInterval` property.

ApiYearlyScheduleCustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs in the customized month based on the number of years provided in the `YearInterval` property.

WeekOfMonth.description:
Specifies the week of the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `first` `second` `third` `fourth` `last`. For example: If you provide second, the schedule will recur on the second week.

DayOfWeek.description:
Specifies the day of week the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `day` `weekday` `weekendday` `Sunday` `Monday`

`Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. For example: If you provide Sunday, the schedule will recur on every sunday's of the second week.

MonthOfYear.description:
Specifies the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `January` `February` `March` `April` `May` `June`

`July` `August` `September` `October` `November` `December`. For example: If you provide March, the schedule will recur on the sunday's of the second week of March every year. Here, the (year) is the value provided in the `YearInterval` property.

Value.description:
Site settings value.

 Valid values: `OrganizationName` `SiteUrl` `TimeZone` `CopyrightInformation` are in `string` 

 `LoginScreenLogo` `EmailLogo` `HeaderLogo` `FooterLogo` `FavIcon` `AILogo` are in `Base64EncodedString` 

 `ShowCopyrightInformation` `ShowPoweredBySyncfusion` `Use24HourFormat` `DisableUserPreference` are in `true` or `false` 

 `DateFormat` is in `MM/dd/yyyy` `dd/MM/yyyy` `d MMM, yyyy` `MMM d, yyyy` 

 `ApplicationLanguage` `DataLanguage` has language code in the following [link](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/office_standards/ms-oe376/6c085406-a698-4e12-9d4d-c3b0ee3dbc4a)

 `TimeZone` has Timezone value from the following [link](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11#time-zones).

Site settings value.

 Valid values: `OrganizationName` `SiteUrl` `TimeZone` `CopyrightInformation` should be `string` 

 `LoginScreenLogo` `EmailLogo` `HeaderLogo` `FooterLogo` `FavIcon` `AILogo` should be `Base64EncodedString` 

 `ShowCopyrightInformation` `ShowPoweredBySyncfusion` `Use24HourFormat` `DisableUserPreference` should be `true` or `false` 

 `DateFormat` should be `MM/dd/yyyy` `dd/MM/yyyy` `d MMM, yyyy` `MMM d, yyyy` 

 `ApplicationLanguage` `DataLanguage` should be any language code in the following [link](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/office_standards/ms-oe376/6c085406-a698-4e12-9d4d-c3b0ee3dbc4a) 

 `TimeZone` should be any Timezone from the following [link](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11#time-zones).

EventTargetUserName.description: The username of the individual targeted by the event in the activity log.

EventTargetDisplayName.description: The display name of the individual targeted by the event in the activity log.

InitiatedUserName.description: The username of the individual who initiated the event recorded in the activity log.

InitiatedDisplayName.description: The display name of the individual who initiated the event recorded in the activity log.

EventDateformat.description: The formatted string representing the date and time when the event was recorded in the activity log.

InitiatedUserEmail.description: The email address of the user who initiated the event recorded in the activity log.

TargetUserEmail.description: The email address of the individual targeted by the event in the activity log.

EventDate.description: The date and time when the event was recorded in the activity log.

EventCategory.description: The numerical identifier representing the category of the event recorded in the activity log.

EventType.description: The numerical identifier representing the specific type of event recorded in the activity log.

AppSource.description: The source application from which the event was generated in the activity log.

AppType.description: The type of application (e.g., API, Web) from which the event was generated in the activity log.

EventCategoryString.description: The string representation of the event category in the activity log.

EventTypeString.description: The string representation of the event type in the activity log.

UserLogDetail.description: Details about the user activity that was logged, including the IP address and user agent.

Summary.description: A brief summary or description of the activity recorded in the log.

IpAddress.description: The IP address from which the activity was logged.

EventLog.description: Details of the event associated with the logged activity, including any changes made.

UserAgent.description: The user agent string that identifies the device and browser used during the logged activity.

ChangeLogCollection.description: A collection of change logs that detail the specific changes made during the logged event.

ChangedItem.description: The name of the item that was changed during the logged event.

ChangeLog.description: A list of specific changes that were made to the `ChangedItem` during the logged event.

ChangedItem.description: The specific item that was altered during the logged event.

From.description: The original value of the item before the change was made.

To.description: The new value of the item after the change was made.
